action: I want to receive real-time notifications for operational anomalies and critical events
reason: Because I need to respond immediately to issues and prevent business downtime or loss
acceptance_criteria: The system shall allow only authenticated users to receive notifications and restrict viewing privileges based on user roles.
The system must automatically generate notifications upon system events, distinguishing by Type (Error/Warning/Info) and Severity (Low/Medium/High/Critical).
The system shall ensure immediate delivery processing for events classified as 'Critical'.
The system must persistently store notifications in the database with Event ID, Timestamp, Type, and Severity.
The system shall manage Read/Unread status on a per-user basis and prevent users from modifying the status of others.
The system must support real-time Web UI updates via WebSocket, enforcing strict authentication token validation for connections.
The system shall support email delivery based on user preferences and providing capabilities for push notification APIs.
The system must process notifications via an asynchronous queue with automatic retry logic for failures (e.g., up to 3 times for email) before logging errors.
The system shall enforce rate limiting to prevent notification spam and overload.
The system must use parameterized queries and input sanitization to prevent SQL injection and XSS attacks.
The system shall provide a search API for notification history allowing filtering by Date Range, Severity, and Type, with strict authorization checks.
The system must allow administration of notification templates and retain a history of modifications.
The system shall support logical deletion of notifications and record the deletion history in the audit log.
The system must store notification logs and audit trails in tamper-evident storage.
The system shall automatically generate alerts when monitored events violate defined Service Level Agreements (SLA).
The API must adhere to REST principles, support versioning, enforce HTTPS (TLS 1.2+), and target a response time of under 500ms for generation.
